questions.question: How many weeks are in one year?
questions.hint: There are 365 days in a year. How many groups of 7 days fit into 365?

questions.question: How many days are in one year?
questions.hint: Think about how many days pass from one birthday to the next!

questions.question: If it is 3:15, what time will it be in 2 hours?
questions.hint: Add the hours first. The minutes stay the same when you only add hours.

questions.question: How many hours are in 2 days?
questions.hint: One day has 24 hours. What is 24 + 24?

questions.question: What time does the clock show if the hour hand is on 7 and the minute hand is on 3?
questions.hint: The minute hand on 3 means 3 groups of 5 minutes. Count by 5s: 5, 10, ...

questions.question: How many days are in 3 weeks?
questions.hint: One week has 7 days. What is 7 + 7 + 7?

questions.question: If today is Wednesday, what day will it be in 5 days?
questions.hint: Count forward from Wednesday: Thursday (1), Friday (2), Saturday (3)...

questions.question: It is 10:30 AM. What time will it be in 1 hour and 30 minutes?
questions.hint: Add 1 hour first to get 11:30. Then add 30 more minutes.

questions.question: How many months have exactly 30 days?
questions.hint: Remember: 30 days has September, April, June, and... which other month?

questions.question: What time does the clock show if the hour hand is on 11 and the minute hand is on 6?
questions.hint: The minute hand on 6 means 6 groups of 5 minutes. What is 6 times 5?

questions.question: If it is 4:45, what time will it be in 30 minutes?
questions.hint: 45 minutes plus 30 minutes equals 75 minutes. But there are only 60 minutes in an hour!

questions.question: How many hours are in 3 days?
questions.hint: Each day has 24 hours. What is 24 + 24 + 24?

questions.question: March is the _____ month of the year.
questions.hint: Count from January: January (1), February (2), March (?).

questions.question: If today is Saturday, what day was it 3 days ago?
questions.hint: Count backward from Saturday: Friday (1 day ago), Thursday (2 days ago)...

questions.question: How many days are in 4 weeks?
questions.hint: One week has 7 days. Multiply 7 by 4.

questions.question: It is 2:40 PM. What time will it be in 25 minutes?
questions.hint: 40 + 25 = 65 minutes. Since 65 is more than 60, the hour changes!

questions.question: How many months are in one year?
questions.hint: Name them: January, February, March... keep counting until December.

questions.question: What time does the clock show if the hour hand is on 9 and the minute hand is on 9?
questions.hint: The minute hand pointing to 9 means 9 groups of 5 minutes. What is 9 x 5?

questions.question: If school starts at 8:00 AM and ends at 3:00 PM, how many hours is the school day?
questions.hint: Count the hours from 8: 9, 10, 11, 12, 1, 2, 3. How many did you count?

questions.question: How many days are in 5 weeks?
questions.hint: Each week has 7 days. What is 5 x 7?

questions.question: It is 6:50 AM. What time will it be in 20 minutes?
questions.hint: 50 + 20 = 70 minutes. Remember, 70 minutes = 1 hour and 10 minutes.

questions.question: November is the _____ month of the year.
questions.hint: September is 9, October is 10, November is...

questions.question: How many minutes are in 2 hours?
questions.hint: One hour has 60 minutes. What is 60 + 60?

questions.question: If a movie starts at 7:15 PM and is 2 hours long, what time does it end?
questions.hint: Add 2 hours to 7:15. The minutes stay the same when adding full hours.

questions.question: How many days are in 2 weeks?
questions.hint: One week has 7 days. What is 7 + 7?

questions.question: What time does the clock show if the hour hand is on 4 and the minute hand is on 12?
questions.hint: When the minute hand points to 12, it means exactly on the hour.

questions.question: If it is 11:45 AM, what time will it be in 30 minutes?
questions.hint: 45 + 30 = 75 minutes. That is 1 hour and 15 minutes. Add to 11:00.

questions.question: How many weeks are in 28 days?
questions.hint: How many groups of 7 fit into 28? Try dividing 28 by 7.

questions.question: June is the _____ month of the year.
questions.hint: April is 4th, May is 5th, June is...

questions.question: It is 1:35 PM. What time will it be in 45 minutes?
questions.hint: 35 + 45 = 80 minutes. That is 1 hour and 20 minutes.

questions.question: How many days are in February during a regular year?
questions.hint: February is the shortest month. In most years, it has how many days?

questions.question: If today is the 15th of the month, what date was it one week ago?
questions.hint: One week = 7 days. Subtract 7 from 15.

questions.question: What time does the clock show if the hour hand is between 2 and 3, and the minute hand is on 6?
questions.hint: If the hour hand is between 2 and 3, the hour is 2. The minute hand on 6 means 30 minutes.

questions.question: How many hours are in half a day?
questions.hint: A full day has 24 hours. What is half of 24?

questions.question: It is 9:20 AM. What time was it 35 minutes ago?
questions.hint: Go back in time! 20 minutes - 35 minutes means borrowing from the hour.

questions.question: How many months have 31 days?
questions.hint: January, March, May, July, August, October, December. Count them!

questions.question: If class starts at 9:15 and lasts for 45 minutes, what time does class end?
questions.hint: 15 + 45 = 60 minutes. 60 minutes equals 1 full hour!

questions.question: What day comes 10 days after Monday?
questions.hint: 10 days = 1 week (7 days) + 3 more days. Count 3 days after Monday.

questions.question: How many minutes are in 1 hour and 30 minutes?
questions.hint: Convert 1 hour to minutes first (60 minutes), then add the extra 30.

questions.question: If it takes 15 minutes to walk to school, and school starts at 8:00 AM, what is the latest time you should leave home?
questions.hint: Work backward from 8:00 AM. Subtract the walking time.

questions.question: New York is 3 hours ahead of Los Angeles. If it is 2:00 PM in Los Angeles, what time is it in New York?
questions.hint: When a city is 'ahead,' you add hours. Add 3 hours to 2:00 PM.

questions.question: A flight departs at 9:30 AM and arrives at 2:15 PM the same day. How long is the flight?
questions.hint: Count from 9:30 to 2:15. First count full hours, then the extra minutes.

questions.question: London is 5 hours ahead of New York. If it is 10:00 PM in New York, what time is it in London?
questions.hint: Add 5 hours to 10:00 PM. When you pass midnight, a new day begins!

questions.question: A train leaves at 11:45 AM and the journey takes 3 hours 25 minutes. What time does it arrive?
questions.hint: Add 3 hours first (11:45 becomes 2:45), then add 25 more minutes.

questions.question: How many hours are in one week?
questions.hint: Each day has 24 hours. How many hours in 7 days?

questions.question: Tokyo is 14 hours ahead of New York. If it is 8:00 AM Monday in New York, what time and day is it in Tokyo?
questions.hint: Add 14 hours to 8:00 AM. Does the day change?

questions.question: A soccer practice starts at 4:30 PM and ends at 6:15 PM. How long is the practice?
questions.hint: From 4:30 to 6:30 would be 2 hours. But practice ends at 6:15...

questions.question: If a leap year has 366 days, how many weeks and extra days are in a leap year?
questions.hint: Divide 366 by 7. The quotient is full weeks, the remainder is extra days.

questions.question: Sydney is 16 hours ahead of New York. If it is 6:00 PM Friday in New York, what time and day is it in Sydney?
questions.hint: Add 16 hours to 6:00 PM. Past midnight means a new day!

questions.question: A bus leaves every 45 minutes. If the first bus leaves at 7:00 AM, when does the third bus leave?
questions.hint: The third bus leaves after two 45-minute intervals. What is 2 x 45?

questions.question: How many seconds are in 5 minutes?
questions.hint: One minute has 60 seconds. Multiply 60 by 5.

questions.question: Paris is 6 hours ahead of New York. A video call is scheduled for 3:00 PM New York time. What time should the person in Paris join?
questions.hint: Add 6 hours to 3:00 PM to find the Paris time.

questions.question: A library is open from 9:00 AM to 8:30 PM. How many hours and minutes is the library open?
questions.hint: Count from 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM (11 hours), then add the extra 30 minutes.

questions.question: If today is March 28th, what date will it be in 2 weeks?
questions.hint: March has 31 days. Add 14 days to March 28th and see if you cross into April.

questions.question: A cake needs to bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. If you put it in the oven at 3:50 PM, when should you take it out?
questions.hint: Add 1 hour to get 4:50, then add 15 more minutes.

questions.question: How many minutes are in half a day?
questions.hint: Half a day is 12 hours. Multiply 12 by 60 to get minutes.

questions.question: Denver is 2 hours behind New York. If it is 1:00 PM in Denver, what time is it in New York?
questions.hint: When a city is 'behind,' the other city is ahead. Add 2 hours to Denver time.

questions.question: A meeting starts at 2:45 PM and lasts 2 hours 35 minutes. What time does it end?
questions.hint: Add 2 hours first (4:45), then add 35 minutes. Watch for going over 60 minutes!

questions.question: How many days are there from July 15th to August 10th (counting both days)?
questions.hint: July has 31 days. Count remaining days in July, then add August days.

questions.question: Dubai is 9 hours ahead of New York. If a flight departs New York at 11:00 PM and takes 14 hours, what local time does it arrive in Dubai?
questions.hint: First find New York time after 14 hours, then add 9 hours for Dubai time.

questions.question: School ends at 3:15 PM. If soccer practice starts 45 minutes after school ends, what time does practice start?
questions.hint: Add 45 minutes to 3:15. Remember, 60 minutes = 1 hour!

questions.question: How many quarters of an hour are in 3 hours?
questions.hint: A quarter hour is 15 minutes. How many 15-minute chunks fit in 180 minutes?

questions.question: Singapore is 13 hours ahead of New York. If it is 7:00 AM Tuesday in Singapore, what time and day is it in New York?
questions.hint: Go backward 13 hours from 7:00 AM. Does the day change?

questions.question: A TV show starts at 7:30 PM and lasts 1 hour 45 minutes. It is followed by a 15-minute commercial break. What time does the next show start?
questions.hint: Add the show length (1:45) and commercial break (0:15) to find the total time.

questions.question: From January 1st to March 15th, how many days pass (not counting January 1st)?
questions.hint: Count remaining days in January (30), all of February (28 in regular year), and 15 in March.

questions.question: If it is 11:30 PM and you need to wake up at 6:45 AM, how many hours and minutes of sleep can you get?
questions.hint: Count from 11:30 PM to midnight, then from midnight to 6:45 AM.

questions.question: Chicago is 1 hour behind New York. A flight leaves New York at 2:30 PM and takes 2 hours 15 minutes. What local time does it arrive in Chicago?
questions.hint: First find arrival in New York time, then subtract 1 hour for Chicago.

questions.question: How many half hours are in one full day?
questions.hint: A day has 24 hours. Each hour has 2 half hours. Multiply!

questions.question: A train departs at 8:55 AM and arrives at 1:20 PM. How long is the journey?
questions.hint: From 8:55 to 9:00 is 5 minutes. Then count from 9:00 to 1:20.

questions.question: If a clock loses 5 minutes every hour, and it shows 3:00 PM after running for 4 hours, what is the actual time?
questions.hint: The clock lost 5 minutes per hour for 4 hours. How much total time was lost?

questions.question: Berlin is 6 hours ahead of New York. A business meeting is at 9:00 AM in Berlin. What time should the New York participant dial in?
questions.hint: Go backward 6 hours from 9:00 AM Berlin time.

questions.question: How many seconds are in 1 hour?
questions.hint: First find how many seconds in 1 minute (60), then multiply by 60 minutes.

questions.question: A movie is 2 hours 25 minutes long. If it starts at 7:45 PM, what time does it end?
questions.hint: Add 2 hours to get 9:45, then add 25 more minutes.

questions.question: From September 5th to October 20th, how many complete weeks pass?
questions.hint: First find total days: remaining days in September plus days in October. Then divide by 7.

questions.question: A store opens at 10:00 AM and closes at 9:00 PM Monday through Saturday. How many total hours is the store open per week?
questions.hint: First find hours open per day, then multiply by number of days open.

questions.question: If the time in Los Angeles is 4:00 PM and Tokyo is 17 hours ahead, what time is it in Tokyo?
questions.hint: Add 17 hours to 4:00 PM. Count past midnight!

questions.question: A doctor's appointment is scheduled for 2:30 PM. If you arrive 20 minutes early and wait 35 minutes past your appointment time, how long do you wait in total?
questions.hint: Add the early arrival time to the late wait time.

questions.question: How many days are in the last quarter of the year (October, November, December)?
questions.hint: Add up the days: October (31) + November (30) + December (31).

questions.question: A plane leaves Miami at 6:15 AM and flies for 3 hours 50 minutes. What time does it land?
questions.hint: Add 3 hours to get 9:15, then add 50 minutes.

questions.question: Beijing is 13 hours ahead of New York. If it's noon on Wednesday in Beijing, what time and day is it in New York?
questions.hint: Go back 13 hours from noon. Do you cross midnight backward?

questions.question: A parking meter accepts money for up to 2 hours. If you park at 11:40 AM and pay for maximum time, when does the meter expire?
questions.hint: Add 2 hours to 11:40 AM.

questions.question: How many months have fewer than 31 days?
questions.hint: Count months with 28, 29, or 30 days: February, April, June, September, November.

questions.question: A concert starts at 8:00 PM and has two 45-minute sets with a 20-minute intermission. What time does it end?
questions.hint: Add both sets (45+45) and the intermission (20) to find total duration.

questions.question: If you read for 25 minutes each day, how many hours and minutes do you read in one week?
questions.hint: Multiply 25 minutes by 7 days, then convert to hours and minutes.

questions.question: Mumbai is 10.5 hours ahead of New York (half hour time zone). If it's 3:00 PM in New York, what time is it in Mumbai?
questions.hint: Add 10 hours and 30 minutes to 3:00 PM.

questions.question: School is in session for 180 days per year. If there are 5 school days per week, how many complete weeks of school are there?
questions.hint: Divide 180 by 5 to find the number of weeks.

questions.question: A baker starts work at 4:30 AM and works for 8 hours 45 minutes. What time does the baker finish?
questions.hint: Add 8 hours first (12:30 PM), then add 45 minutes.

questions.question: From April 10th to June 10th, how many days pass (not counting April 10th)?
questions.hint: Count remaining days in April (20), all of May (31), and 10 in June.

questions.question: If a meeting is scheduled for every other Wednesday starting January 8th, on what date is the third meeting?
questions.hint: Count: 1st meeting Jan 8, 2nd meeting 2 weeks later, 3rd meeting 2 more weeks later.

questions.question: A stopwatch shows 4:35:42. What does this mean?
questions.hint: Stopwatches typically show hours:minutes:seconds.

questions.question: San Francisco is 3 hours behind New York. If a TV show airs live at 9:00 PM Eastern (New York), what time do viewers in San Francisco see it?
questions.hint: Subtract 3 hours from 9:00 PM to find Pacific time.

questions.question: How many 15-minute intervals are there from 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM?
questions.hint: First find total minutes (210), then divide by 15.

questions.question: A flight departs at 11:50 PM and lands at 5:25 AM the next day. How long is the flight?
questions.hint: Count from 11:50 PM to midnight (10 min), then from midnight to 5:25 AM.

questions.question: If a baby is born at 11:45 PM on December 31st, how many minutes until the New Year?
questions.hint: How many minutes are left until midnight (12:00 AM)?

questions.question: A train runs every 20 minutes starting at 6:10 AM. What time is the 5th train?
questions.hint: The 5th train comes after 4 intervals of 20 minutes. Add 80 minutes to 6:10 AM.

questions.question: How many days are in the first half of a regular (non-leap) year (January through June)?
questions.hint: Add: January(31) + February(28) + March(31) + April(30) + May(31) + June(30).

questions.question: Moscow is 8 hours ahead of New York. A flight leaves New York at 5:00 PM, takes 10 hours, and lands in Moscow. What local time does it land?
questions.hint: Add 10 hours flight time to 5:00 PM, then add 8 hours for Moscow time zone.

questions.question: A class starts at 10:20 AM. Students need 5 minutes to settle in before the lesson begins. If the lesson is 40 minutes, when does it end?
questions.hint: Add settling time (5 min) plus lesson time (40 min) to the start time.

questions.question: If today is the 25th of a month with 30 days, how many days until the 10th of next month?
questions.hint: Count remaining days this month, then add 10 days of next month.

questions.question: A digital clock shows 23:45. What time is this in 12-hour format?
questions.hint: Subtract 12 from 23 to convert from 24-hour to 12-hour format after noon.

questions.question: Sydney is 16 hours ahead of Los Angeles. A live sports event starts at 2:00 PM Saturday in Sydney. What time and day is it in Los Angeles?
questions.hint: Go back 16 hours from 2:00 PM. Does the day change?

questions.question: A cafeteria serves lunch from 11:30 AM to 1:15 PM. How long is lunch service?
questions.hint: From 11:30 to 1:30 would be 2 hours, but service ends earlier.

questions.question: How many complete months are between March 15th and September 15th (not counting March or September)?
questions.hint: List the months between: April, May, June, July, August.

questions.question: A shuttle bus runs every 12 minutes. If you just missed a bus at 3:47 PM, when is the next bus?
questions.hint: Add 12 minutes to 3:47 PM.

questions.question: How many decades are in one century?
questions.hint: A decade is 10 years, a century is 100 years. How many 10s fit in 100?

questions.question: A pharmacy is open 24 hours. If a prescription takes 45 minutes to fill and you drop it off at 11:40 PM, when is it ready?
questions.hint: Add 45 minutes to 11:40 PM. You will cross midnight!

questions.question: If you save $5 every week, how many weeks until you have saved for at least 3 months (13 weeks)?
questions.hint: 13 weeks is approximately 3 months.

questions.question: A recipe says to bake for 55 minutes, then cool for 30 minutes. If you start baking at 4:35 PM, when can you serve?
questions.hint: Add total time (55 + 30 = 85 minutes = 1 hour 25 minutes) to start time.

questions.question: Hong Kong is 13 hours ahead of New York. A video call is at 8:00 AM Hong Kong time. What time is this in New York?
questions.hint: Go back 13 hours from 8:00 AM. You'll end up in the previous day.

questions.question: How many hours pass from 6:00 AM Thursday to 6:00 AM Saturday?
questions.hint: Count the full days: Thursday to Friday (24 hours) + Friday to Saturday (24 hours).

questions.question: A school play has 3 acts of 25 minutes each with two 10-minute intermissions. What is the total length?
questions.hint: Add all three acts (25x3) plus both intermissions (10x2).

questions.question: If a leap year falls every 4 years, how many leap years are there in 100 years (not accounting for century rules)?
questions.hint: Divide 100 by 4 to find how many leap years.

questions.question: A flight from London to New York takes 8 hours. London is 5 hours ahead. If the flight leaves London at 10:00 AM, what local time does it arrive in New York?
questions.hint: After 8 hours, it's 6:00 PM London time. Then subtract 5 hours for New York.

questions.question: How many minutes are in a quarter of a day?
questions.hint: A quarter of a day is 6 hours. Convert 6 hours to minutes.

questions.question: A music class meets for 50 minutes twice a week. How many total hours of music class are there in 9 weeks?
questions.hint: 50 min x 2 days = 100 min per week. Multiply by 9, then convert to hours.

questions.question: If it is 4:00 PM on January 31st, what time and date is it 36 hours later?
questions.hint: 36 hours = 24 hours (one day) + 12 hours. Add to January 31st, 4:00 PM.

questions.question: A swimming pool is open from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM. How many hours is it open daily?
questions.hint: Count from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM. Remember, 10:00 PM is 22:00 in 24-hour time.

questions.question: Vancouver is 3 hours behind Toronto. If a webinar starts at 2:00 PM Toronto time and lasts 90 minutes, what time does it end in Vancouver?
questions.hint: Find end time in Toronto (3:30 PM), then subtract 3 hours.

questions.question: How many weeks are in 6 months (assuming 26 weeks)?
questions.hint: Half a year is approximately 26 weeks.

questions.question: A bus leaves the station at 7:25 AM and takes 1 hour 48 minutes to reach its destination. What time does it arrive?
questions.hint: Add 1 hour to get 8:25, then add 48 minutes. Watch for going over 60!

questions.question: From November 20th to February 14th of the next year, how many complete months pass (not including partial months)?
questions.hint: Which months are fully contained? December and January are complete months.

questions.question: A 24-hour clock shows 00:30. What time is this?
questions.hint: 00:30 is 30 minutes after midnight.

questions.question: If you exercise for 45 minutes every day, how many hours do you exercise in February of a leap year?
questions.hint: Leap year February has 29 days. Multiply 45 minutes by 29 and convert.

questions.question: Auckland, New Zealand is 18 hours ahead of New York. If it's 9:00 PM Friday in New York, what time and day is it in Auckland?
questions.hint: Add 18 hours to 9:00 PM Friday. You'll cross midnight into Saturday.

questions.question: A timer is set for 2 hours 15 minutes. If started at 10:50 AM, when will it go off?
questions.hint: Add 2 hours (12:50) then 15 minutes.

questions.question: How many fortnights (2-week periods) are in one year?
questions.hint: 52 weeks in a year. Divide by 2 to find fortnights.

questions.question: A conference call includes people from 3 time zones: New York (EST), London (5 hours ahead), and Tokyo (14 hours ahead). If the call is at 8:00 AM New York time, what time is it in Tokyo?
questions.hint: Add 14 hours to 8:00 AM.

questions.question: A game starts at 7:00 PM and each quarter is 12 minutes with 5 minutes between quarters. How long until the game ends?
questions.hint: 4 quarters x 12 minutes + 3 breaks x 5 minutes.

questions.question: If today is a Thursday and 100 days pass, what day of the week will it be?
questions.hint: 100 days = 14 weeks and 2 days. Count 2 days after Thursday.

questions.question: A flight crosses 6 time zones heading west. If it departs at 3:00 PM local time and takes 7 hours, what is the local arrival time?
questions.hint: 7 hours flight, but going west means subtracting 6 hours. Net change: 7-6=1 hour later.

questions.question: How many times does a clock's minute hand pass 12 in one full day?
questions.hint: The minute hand passes 12 once per hour. How many hours in a day?

questions.question: A semester is 16 weeks long. If classes meet Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, how many class meetings are there (assuming no holidays)?
questions.hint: 3 classes per week times 16 weeks.

questions.question: If a clock gains 3 minutes every hour, and it shows 5:00 PM after running for 5 hours, what is the actual time?
questions.hint: The clock gained 3 min/hour x 5 hours = 15 minutes. Subtract to find actual time.

questions.question: A bakery opens at 5:30 AM and an employee works an 8-hour shift. If the employee takes a 30-minute unpaid lunch, what time does the shift end?
questions.hint: 8 hours of work + 30 min lunch = 8.5 hours total at the bakery.

questions.question: Cape Town is 7 hours ahead of New York. A flight leaves New York at 6:00 PM, takes 17 hours, and lands in Cape Town. What local time does it land?
questions.hint: Add 17 hours to 6:00 PM (11:00 AM next day NY time), then add 7 hours.

questions.question: How many 5-minute intervals are in 3 hours?
questions.hint: 3 hours = 180 minutes. Divide by 5.

questions.question: A project is due in 6 weeks and 4 days. How many days is that?
questions.hint: 6 weeks = 42 days. Add 4 more days.

questions.question: If a business operates in 3 shifts of 8 hours each, how many worker-hours is that per day?
questions.hint: 3 shifts x 8 hours = total worker-hours per day.

questions.question: From 9:45 AM to 3:20 PM, how much time passes?
questions.hint: From 9:45 to 3:45 is 6 hours. But it ends at 3:20, which is 25 minutes less.

questions.question: A marathon starts at 7:00 AM. The winner finishes in 2 hours 8 minutes. The last runner finishes 4 hours after the winner. What time does the last runner finish?
questions.hint: Winner finishes at 9:08 AM. Add 4 hours for the last runner.

questions.question: How many quarter hours are in 5 hours?
questions.hint: Each hour has 4 quarter hours (15 min each). Multiply 4 by 5.

questions.question: A TV series has 10 episodes, each 42 minutes long. How long does it take to watch the whole series?
questions.hint: 10 x 42 = 420 minutes. Convert to hours and minutes.

questions.question: If a year starts on a Monday, what day does February 1st fall on (non-leap year)?
questions.hint: January has 31 days. 31 = 4 weeks + 3 days. Count 3 days after Monday.

questions.question: A medicine must be taken every 6 hours. If the first dose is at 7:30 AM, when is the 4th dose?
questions.hint: 4th dose is 3 intervals of 6 hours = 18 hours after the first dose.

questions.question: How many leap years occur between 2000 and 2040 (inclusive)?
A bus takes 35 minutes for its route and waits 10 minutes at each end. How long until the same bus returns to a stop?
questions.hint: Round trip: 35 min there + 10 min wait + 35 min back + 10 min wait.

questions.question: Daylight Saving Time moves clocks forward 1 hour. If it's 1:45 AM before the change, what time is it after?
questions.hint: Spring forward means adding 1 hour to the current time.

questions.question: A 90-day trial period starts on October 15th. When does it end?
questions.hint: Count: Oct (16 days left) + Nov (30) + Dec (31) + Jan (13) = 90 days.

questions.question: How many times does the hour hand complete a full rotation in one week?
questions.hint: The hour hand goes around twice per day (AM and PM). Multiply by 7 days.

questions.question: A store has a sale that lasts from 9:00 AM Friday to 9:00 PM Sunday. How many hours is the sale?
questions.hint: Friday 9AM to Saturday 9AM = 24 hrs. Saturday 9AM to Sunday 9AM = 24 hrs. Sunday 9AM to 9PM = 12 hrs.
